All Classes

Class Summary 
Class Description
Camera
The Camera class which creates the camera through which we see our Image object and which creates Rays for our Renderer.
Color
The Color class is used to give the SceneObjects a color.
Controller
The Controller class which controls the whole application and the only way from which we can interact with the Renderer class through the main method.
Driver
The Driver class which contains the main method.
Image
The Image class is used to represent an Image (or frame if you will) that gets projected on the screen by the renderer and is seen by the Camera.
Light
The light class inherits from abstract class SceneObject to give the light a color and a position.
Options
The Options class is used to store all the options relating to the raytracer (can contain more options at a later stage).
Plane
The Plane class is a geometry that extends the abstract Shape class which has the abstract method 'intersects' to see if a ray intersects with a geometry.
Ray
The Ray class is used to represent a ray that gets shot from the Camera object and into the scene to look for intersections with Shape objects or Light objects.
RayHit
The RayHit class is used to contain information about an intersection between a Ray object and a Shape object.
Renderer
The Renderer class which does all the heavy lifting.
Scene
The Scene class holds everything that can be viewed through the camera.
SceneObject
The SceneObject is the abstract parent class of all the objects that can be added to the Scene.
Shape
Abstract class Shape from which geometries can inherit the abstract method intersects.
Sphere
The Sphere class is a geometry that extends the abstract Shape class which has the abstract method 'intersects' to see if a ray intersects with a geometry.
TestDriver
The TestDriver class is used to run all the unit tests.
Vector3D
The Vector3D class is used to represent a three dimensional vector that can be used for calculations in the three dimensional space.
Vector3DTest
The Vector3DTest is a test class for all the Vector3D methods.
